issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Here's what I see when using Hadoop in Bigtop:

{noformat}
$ sudo /sbin/service hadoop-hdfs-namenode start
Starting Hadoop namenode daemon (hadoop-namenode): chown: changing ownership of `/var/log/hadoop': Operation not permitted
starting namenode, logging to /var/log/hadoop/hadoop-hdfs-namenode-centos5.out
{noformat}

This is a cosmetic issue, but it would be nice to fix it.
fields.summary: hadoop-daemon.sh and yarn-daemon.sh are trying to mkdir and chow log/pid dirs which can fail

comments.body: I've committed this and merged to 23. Thanks Roman!

Integrated in Hadoop-Hdfs-trunk-Commit #1715 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-Hdfs-trunk-Commit/1715/])
    HADOOP-8012. hadoop-daemon.sh and yarn-daemon.sh are trying to mkdir and chown log/pid dirs which can fail. Contributed by Roman Shaposhnik
